docs.snippet: FROM Buenos Aires comes a photograph of the 5-centavos stamp to be issued, probably  on Oct. 12, to commemorate the opening of the international bridge erected between Argentina and Brazil. The color is expected to be red-brown. The span is pictured...
docs.lead_paragraph: FROM Buenos Aires comes a photograph of the 5-centavos stamp to be issued, probably on Oct. 12, to commemorate the opening of the international bridge erected between Argentina and Brazil. The color is expected to be red-brown. The span is pictured and "Puente Internacional Argentina-Brasil 12 de Octubre de 1945" is inscribed.

docs.snippet: QUEBEC, Oct. 16--Representatives of thirty countries signed today the constitution of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, pledging their Governments' cooperation in this new international body.
docs.lead_paragraph: QUEBEC, Oct. 16--Representatives of thirty countries signed today the constitution of the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, pledging their Governments' cooperation in this new international body.
docs.abstract: Sees United Nations Food and Agr Cong aiding world peace

headline.main: 30 COUNTRIES SIGN FOOD BODY CHARTER; Constitution Adopted to Start World Organization--First Plenary Session Held

byline.original: By WALTER H. WAGGONER Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 19--The general strike ended at midnight and Argentina, after a week of turmoil, chaos and unexpected events, was rapidly returning today to what for many months past it had been obliged to regard as a normal condition.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 19--The general strike ended at midnight and Argentina, after a week of turmoil, chaos and unexpected events, was rapidly returning today to what for many months past it had been obliged to regard as a normal condition.
docs.abstract: Takes refuge in Uruguayan Embassy, Buenos Aires

headline.main: PERON OPPONENTS IN ARGENTINA HIDE; Capital Appears to Be Quiet but Armed Police Take Unusual Precautions NEW ARRESTS REPORTED Late News From Provinces Indicates Much Violence by Dictatorial Faction

docs.snippet: CARACAS, Venezuela, Oct. 20-- Rebel warplanes bombed Caracas late today and heavy fighting broke out in the city between revolutionary troops and national guard units loyal to the deposed President, Gen. Isaias Medina Angarita. Casualties of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela, Oct. 20-- Rebel warplanes bombed Caracas late today and heavy fighting broke out in the city between revolutionary troops and national guard units loyal to the deposed President, Gen. Isaias Medina Angarita. Casualties of the thirtysix-hour-old revolution were estimated at 300 dead and more than 1,000 wounded.
docs.abstract: Pres Lleras Camargo denies reptd aid to pro-Medina troops in Venezuelan revolt

headline.main: STIFF FIGHT RAGING IN VENEZUELA CITY; 300 REPORPED DEAD; Rebel Planes Bomb Caracas as Loyal Troops Try to Rescue Ousted President, Staff NEW RULERS TIGHTEN GRIP Bettancourt, Head of Regime, Pledges Free Elections-- Reassures U.S. Envoy
